intro: Evolvulus glomeratus f. strictus, commonly known as the compact blue morning glory, is a compact variant of the species native to the southern United States. It is characterized by its small, tightly clustered flowers that bloom in shades of blue and violet. The plant has trailing stems that produce numerous small, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This cultivar is often used in containers or as a ground cover due to its dense growth habit.
